definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)

sentences.english: Dave Miller would never have done it, had he been in his right mind.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫米勒若當時頭腦清楚，就不會幹這擋子事了。

sentences.english: Remain clearheaded, even if the topic is emotional.
sentences.chinese: 保持頭腦清楚，即使話題讓人激動。

sentences.english: My mind was clarified and changed on this issue.
sentences.chinese: 我的頭腦清楚了，改變了對這個問題的看法。

sentences.english: 'Conventional running is my sanity,' Gov. Palin says.
sentences.chinese: 佩林說，“傳統式的跑步能讓我保持頭腦清楚。”
餓不死的，餓了可以頭腦清楚點。

sentences.english: You won't die of hunger. It should clear your head a little.
sentences.chinese: 餓不死的，餓了可以頭腦清楚點。

sentences.english: Mother is quite reasonable most of the time.
sentences.chinese: 大多數時間母親頭腦清楚。

sentences.english: Second, he must always keep his mind fresh by setting aside some time for exercise.
sentences.chinese: 其次，他必須撥出時間來運動以保持頭腦清楚。
